prompt.content:
One type of beetle has 3 possible wing colors, blue, green and turquoise. Randomly caught individuals of a polymorphic population were crossed with each other.
It is a monohybrid inheritance with three alleles, B, G & T. Dominance: B > G > T
You get the parent phenotype, and the distribution of phenotypes in the F1 - generation. State the genotypes of the parents and offspring as accurately as possible. No further explanation necessary. If a given distribution is impossible, state 'impossible'.
Example task:
Blue x Blue -> 4/4 Blue
Example solution:
BB x B_ -> 4/4 B_
Example Task:
Blue x Blue -> 3/4 Blue 1/4 Green
Example Solution:
BG x BG -> 1/4 BB, 1/2 BG, 1/4 GG
Blue x Blue -> 4/4 Blue

One type of beetle has 3 possible wing colors, blue, green and turquoise. Randomly caught individuals of a polymorphic population were crossed with each other.

Example Task:

Example Solution:

Blue x Gree -> 1/2 Blue 1/2 Green

Sure! Here's the solution:

BB (Blue) x BB (Blue) -> 3/4 BB (Blue), 1/4 BG (Green)

The parents are both BB (Blue), so the F1 generation will have a chance of inheriting either two B alleles (resulting in BB, or Blue) or one B and one G allele (resulting in BG, or Green). The probability of inheriting two B alleles is 3/4, and the probability of inheriting one B and one G allele is 1/4. Therefore, the F1 generation will have a 3:1 ratio of Blue to Green individuals.

data.sampled:
BB x BB -> 1/4 BB, 1/2 BG, 1/4 GG

The parents are both BB (blue), so the possible genotypes of the offspring are:

* BB (blue)
* BG (blue-green)
* GG (green)

The probability of each genotype is:

* BB: 1/4 (25%)
* BG: 1/2 (50%)
* GG: 1/4 (25%)

So, the distribution of phenotypes in the F1 generation is:

* Blue: 3/4 (75%)
* Green: 1/4 (25%)

This is a possible outcome, as the inheritance of the blue, green, and turquoise colors follows a monohybrid inheritance pattern with three alleles, and the dominance order is B > G > T.
